Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2014 02:18PM Aimee68 wrote: I had a routine mammo last june which was clear, but showed the tail end of a lymph node. I had a PET scan( which lit up in that area), so they removed it and biopsied it. ( I guess it was the size of a ping-pong ball). The pathology report came back as benign reactive. They don't know why this occured. 4-6 weeks after the surgery, I started to develop some slight swelling and Orange peel-like skin on the same breast. It itches on occasion. I have had two breast surgeons/specialists tell me that this is a complication of the lymph node removal I am still VERY worried thaough.
Posts.Title: One Swollen Auxiliary Lymph Node, worried! Doctor seems puzzled wondering22 wondering22

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2014 11:09PM Aimee68 wrote: I had a 3 cm axillary lymph node removed last fall because it showed up on a mammogram. The biopsy said it was benign reactive. About 4-6 weeks later I developed slight swelling and orange peel like/enlarged pores on under side of breast and around areola. Â It is very itchy at times, and I have pain in armpit and breast. These symptoms have occurred intermittently over the past few months. I have had three breast surgeons tell me that it is breast lymphedema. I am not so sure.
Posts.Title: Could rash and swelling be LE? 1toughmomma 1toughmomma

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2014 10:58AM Aimee68 wrote: It was really close to the breast, kind of in the breast tissue itself. I have seen a therapist for manual drainage, but haven't been keeping up with the exercises very well.I guess I still have a hard time believing that it is not something more serious.
